comments.body: When Is_dynamic_op is false, can we leave these two argument unspecified?
Yes we can but they will be initialized to their current values. I added them for sake of completeness.

      is_dynamic_op=False,
      maximum_cached_engines=1,
      cached_engine_batches=[])
  o1 = run_graph(orig_graph, dummy_input)

comments.body:
Please turn this into a python test. There are many examples, such as [this one](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/client/session_test.py).
We can use [yapf](https://github.com/google/yapf) to format the python code, just fyi.

Sure @aaroey,

Would it be better to prepare a separate PR for this? This script is not meant to be used as an automated test but a interactive test to see if everything functioning as expected. Proper testing would be more complicated. I think we can do another PR for test version of this and add subsequent tests in later PRs. Does this sound good?
Sure. Let's exclude it in this PR then.
